results.title: How it happens
results.creator_credit: Ritter-Jepperson Studios and Victorian Road Safety Division
results.brief_description: The experiences of a small boy, injured in a road accident, are used to emphasise why children should obey the following safety rules: play where it is safe - not on the roadways; look both ways when crossing streets; never ride bicycles more than two abreast; never run out onto roads from behind stationary vehicles.

results.title: House of Wax lobby cards
results.brief_description: Reproduction movie lobby card set for the promotio of the film ‘House of Wax’ a Warner Brothers production c1953. The set contains a series of eight colour pinted cards with illustrated scenes from the movie and graphic text noting ‘Natural Vision, Color by Warner Color, 3 Dimension, House of Wax.

results.title: Hotel New York
results.brief_description: This is the final version of “New York” shown by Jackie Raynal in 1980 as a work-in-progress. It is the story of Loulou Blanchot, a French filmmaker who decides to live in New York after having been invited to show one of her films there. Loulou begins to get acquainted with the city and gets a job as an editor for a porno film company.

results.title: Hospital school
results.brief_description: At the Lord Mayor Treloar Cripples Hospital and College every facility for the treatment, education and vocational training of physically handicapped children is provided. This film shows the observation ward, the X-ray department, the operating theatres, the massage and exercise room, and the bright airy wards and sunny terraces where the children’s schooling takes place simultaneously with their medical treatment.

results.title: Hook, line and sinker
results.creator_credit: Roy Layzell, Andrew Rice and Esso Film Unit
results.brief_description: A description of the trip made by a new type of line fishing vessel on her maiden voyage to northern waters. Demonstrates the modern equipment of the Scottish-built ship with its refrigeration, line hauling tackle and diesel engine and brings out the skill and efficiency of the crew.

results.title: Hong Kong: wandering with Rick
results.brief_description: With Rick we take a ferry-boat across Repulse Bay and catch a cable car up Victoria Peak for a panoramic view of Hong Kong. We ride a sampan from a fishing village, visit the busy docks of Hong Kong harbour and enjoy a rick-shaw ride through crowqded city streets.

results.title: Hong Kong
results.brief_description: This is a British account of one of its colonies for over one hundred years. It describes the positive influences from Britain on the economy but also documents influences from China due to the large Chinese population, on culture and family. Also recognises China’s desire to regain Hong Kong.

results.title: Homage a George Bizet
results.brief_description: Biographical account of Georges Bizet’s life supported by and illustrated with excerpts from his compositions. Particularly featured are L’Arlierienne and Carmen. In French language only.

results.title: Hitch hiker
results.creator_credit: Gerald Varney, Polly Turner and CPC Productions
results.brief_description: Young hitchhikers are interviewed and we hear their philosophy regarding hitchhiking. We hear their poetry, see them camping amid spectacular scenery and meet the people who are willing to pick them up. This activity is seen as a rebellion to parental authority and a statement of individualism.
